name: Francine Jordi
description:
'''Francine Jordi''' (born '''Francine Lehmann''', 24 June 1977) is a Swiss [[Pop music|pop]] singer.

As a young child, she sang songs for Japanese tourists in [[Interlaken]]. With this musical background she won the [[Germany|German]] [[Grand Prix der Volksmusik]] in 1998 with the song "Das Feuer der Sehnsucht". Jordi subsequently became a star in Switzerland with chart success singing mostly in German and leading to golden records and tours throughout not only Switzerland, but also Germany and Austria. She hosted two TV shows at the [[ARD (broadcaster)|ARD]]. In 2002, she represented Switzerland at the [[Eurovision Song Contest]] in [[Tallinn]] with a [[French language]] song "[[Dans le jardin de mon Ã¢me]]". In autumn that year, she made a solo tour with her band in Switzerland.

As of September 2015, Jordi has been presenter of the long-running TV show, ''[[Musikantenstadl]]''.
